title: coinfunda
author: coinfunda
content: Dear members,If I send sMerit to someone if I noticed some deserving post, then it will be deducted from my merit balance?

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Smerit is different from ur main merit in your merit count For each 2 merits you earn, you have 1 sendable merit, and when you send out that one, it won't affect the 2 you have earned, but the sendable one will reduce that if you have more of it. Only your S merit can be reduced, not your earned merit.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: As you have 2 merits, you have 1 smerits. If you have 4 merits, you will have 2 smerits. Your smerits is the halve of the merit that your have been sent. You can send the smerit to anybody's post that is helpful for you. Click on the merit on the post that you want to merit, it is beside quote. Read what is there before sending the merit and all your questions are answered there.

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Quote from: coinfunda on September 24, 2023, 11:31:24 AMDear members,If I send sMerit to someone if I noticed some deserving post, then it will be deducted from my merit balance?There’s a separate balance for available sMerit which is separate to your total merit. Your sent merit will be deducted to your sMerit balance while your total merit will still remain.You can get 0.5sMerit per 1 merit received and sMerit decay on certain amount of time so make sure to share it to deserving post and never hoard any of them. Don’t be afraid that you will lose merit when you send merit to someone.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Quote from: coinfunda on September 24, 2023, 11:31:24 AMDear members,If I send sMerit to someone if I noticed some deserving post, then it will be deducted from my merit balance?Your earned merit won't be deducted when you send a merit to someone else. The only thing that will be deducted is your smerit. For every merit you received you also receive 0.5 smerit therefore when you receive 2 merits then you will also have 1 smerit. It's better to send your smerit than to hoard it as it is useless if you only keep it and never sent to other forum members who deserves it.

comments.author: goxcraft
comments.body: Merit and sMerit are different things. Merit is something you get from other forum users for your quality posts or contributions. sMerit is something you can give others if you think their posts are worthy. Once you earn a merit, it's not going to vanish. It will always be there, no matter what. You will not lose any merit. For every merit you earn, you get half of the sMerit.(OP, you should now lock this topic as you got enough answers.)

comments.author: ZAINmalik75
comments.body: Quote from: coinfunda on September 24, 2023, 11:31:24 AMDear members,If I send sMerit to someone if I noticed some deserving post, then it will be deducted from my merit balance?If you will get 2 merits then you will have only one smerit  (sending merit). This means if you will get 10 merits then those merits will make 5 smerits  that you can send to others. But you are asking if your merits will be reduced if you will send merits to others. The short answer is no. Because as I said before, you get 2 merits that make 1smerit. And the 2 merits that you have received will not go anywhere. They are registered in your profile and the merits that you will send, not be deducted by the merits that have been tagged in your profile. But yeah, you can not send someone endless merits because if you wanted to send smerits then you must have earned some merits too then you will be able to send merits. The best practice that you should perform in this case is, do not start to do merit farming in thinking that you can now send merits to your other account. Because that will not be tolerated.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: coinfunda on September 24, 2023, 11:31:24 AMDear members,If I send sMerit to someone if I noticed some deserving post, then it will be deducted from my merit balance?When you send one smerit to someone then you won't have it anymore, but that won't impact your merit balance. Your merits are yours and no-one can reduce those from your profile. When someone sends you 2 merits you'll gain those merits on your profile and you'll gain 1 smerit that you can send to someone else, and sending of that 1 smerit won't affect your profile merits at all.
